meanings.definition: Committed or promised beyond what is feasible or realistic.
meanings.sent1: She felt overcommitted with all the tasks she had taken on.
meanings.sent2: The team was overcommitted with too many projects to handle effectively.
meanings.sent3: He realized he was overcommitted when he couldn't keep up with all his promises.
meanings.sent4: The budget was overcommitted, leaving no room for unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent5: The student was overcommitted with extracurricular activities, causing stress.

meanings.definition: Engaged in too many activities or obligations.
meanings.sent1: Being overcommitted to various clubs, she had little time for herself.
meanings.sent2: The overcommitted schedule left no room for relaxation or downtime.
meanings.sent3: His calendar was so overcommitted that he forgot about his own birthday.
meanings.sent4: The overcommitted workload weighed heavily on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The company became overcommitted with orders, leading to delays.
